Posts.Content: May 23, 2017 04:14PM adw7374 wrote: Thanks so much for the replies. I believe it would be Twilight Sleep (They called it Mac). Talking to Anethesia tomorrow, so hopfully will get more information.
Posts.Title: Excisional Biopsy-Local (MAC) or General Anesthesia adw7374

Posts.Content: adw7374 wrote: I am considered high risk due to family history and am having a radial scar removed in a few weeks that was recently found with a new cluster of calcifications. I sought out 2 different opinions and feel great about the surgeon I chose (for a variety of reasons). However, she wants to do it under general and the other doctor I saw was fine doing it more local (MAC). I just wondered what the norm was for an excisional biopsy. I've had general before and typically am really sick after. (even with a patch). I also am having this done right in the middle of a very busy work week where I have to be back up and moving within about 36 hours. Just wanted to get other opinions. Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Excisional Biopsy-Local (MAC) or General Anesthesia adw7374
